Assignment 6 api¶

Flask app to create a website where the user can choose different Counties, Chart’s types, periodicity, and date-rage.

web_visualization.plot_reported_cases(county='Alle_Fylker', periodicity='day', start=None, end=None, plot_lib='Altair', view_plot=False, plot_title=False, width=800, height=500)¶

Function to generate a bar-plot for Covid19’s total daily cases from FHI/Norway.

Parameters

  • county – str: Name od the county to be analyzed, which could be ‘Agder’, ‘Innlandet’, ‘More_og_Romsdal’, ‘Nordland’, ‘Oslo’, ‘Rogaland’, ‘Troms_og_Finnmark’, Trondelag’, ‘Vestfold_og_Telemark’, ‘Vestland’, ‘Viken’or ‘Alle_Fylker’ for all counties.

  • periodicity – str: Periodicity to display the plot, which could be ‘day’ or ‘week’. Default ‘day’.

  • start – str or date object: The starting date for the analysis.

  • end – str or date object: The ending date for the analysis.

  • plot_lib – str: The name of the plotting library to be used. Default is ‘Altair’ which uses Altair. A option is ‘plt’ which uses matplotlib.

  • view_plot – bool: The default is False to not show the plot.

  • plot_title – bool: The default is False to not display the plot’s title.

  • width – int: Only used for ‘Altair’ plot. Define the width of the plotting. Default is 800.

  • height – int: Only used for ‘Altair’ plot. Define the height of the plotting. Default is 500.

  • If start and end are None, them it will plot the entire data-base.

web_visualization.plot_cumulative_cases(county='Alle_Fylker', periodicity='day', start=None, end=None, plot_lib='Altair', view_plot=False, plot_title=False, width=800, height=500)¶

Function to generate a line-plot for Covid19’s total daily cases from FHI/Norway.

Parameters

  • county – str: Name od the county to be analyzed, which could be ‘Agder’, ‘Innlandet’, ‘More_og_Romsdal’, ‘Nordland’, ‘Oslo’, ‘Rogaland’, ‘Troms_og_Finnmark’, Trondelag’, ‘Vestfold_og_Telemark’, ‘Vestland’, ‘Viken’or ‘Alle_Fylker’ for all counties.

  • periodicity – str: Periodicity to display the plot, which could be ‘day’ or ‘week’. Default ‘day’.

  • start – str or date object: The starting date for the analysis.

  • end – str or date object: The ending date for the analysis.

  • plot_lib – str: The name of the plotting library to be used. Default is ‘Altair’ which uses Altair. A option is ‘plt’ which uses matplotlib.

  • view_plot – bool: The default is False to not show the plot.

  • plot_title – bool: The default is False to not display the plot’s title.

  • width – int: Only used for ‘Altair’ plot. Define the width of the plotting. Default is 800.

  • height – int: Only used for ‘Altair’ plot. Define the height of the plotting. Default is 500.

  • If start and end are None, them it will plot the entire data-base.

web_visualization.plot_both(county='Alle_Fylker', periodicity='day', start=None, end=None, plot_lib='Altair', view_plot=False, plot_title=False, width=800, height=500)¶

Function to generate a line-plot for Covid19’s total daily cases from FHI/Norway.

Parameters

  • county – str: Name od the county to be analyzed, which could be ‘Agder’, ‘Innlandet’, ‘More_og_Romsdal’, ‘Nordland’, ‘Oslo’, ‘Rogaland’, ‘Troms_og_Finnmark’, Trondelag’, ‘Vestfold_og_Telemark’, ‘Vestland’, ‘Viken’or ‘Alle_Fylker’ for all counties.

  • periodicity – str: Periodicity to display the plot, which could be ‘day’ or ‘week’. Default ‘day’.

  • start – str or date object: The starting date for the analysis.

  • end – str or date object: The ending date for the analysis.

  • plot_lib – str: The name of the plotting library to be used. Default is ‘Altair’ which uses Altair. A option is ‘plt’ which uses matplotlib.

  • view_plot – bool: The default is False to not show the plot.

  • plot_title – bool: The default is False to not display the plot’s title.

  • width – int: Only used for ‘Altair’ plot. Define the width of the plotting. Default is 800.

  • height – int: Only used for ‘Altair’ plot. Define the height of the plotting. Default is 500.

  • If start and end are None, them it will plot the entire data-base.

web_visualization.index()¶

Publishing the index web page.

web_visualization.chart_frame()¶

Publishing the initial chart’s frame web page.

web_visualization.handle_form()¶

Handling the form and getting the chosen chart.
